item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.name: Hybrid, electric, and advanced technology vehicles

summary.text:
Modifies average vehicle fuel economy standards, with respect to alternative fuel automobiles, by:

  • excepting natural gas automobiles from maximum fuel economy increase requirements for model years 1993 through 2019 and from minimum driving range requirements for dual fueled automobiles;
  • allowing inclusion in an alternative fuel vehicle of a reserve gasoline tank for incidental or emergency use;
  • requiring reasonably comparable energy efficiency, as compared to a gasoline- or diesel fuel-vehicle (under current law, "equal or superior energy efficiency"); and
  • revising the formula for measuring the fuel economy of a model of gaseous fuel dual fueled automobiles manufactured in models years 1993 through 2019, including by using the model's alternative fuel range as a base.

bill.title: A bill to provide regulatory parity among alternative fuel vehicles, and for other purposes.

item.title: A bill to provide regulatory parity among alternative fuel vehicles, and for other purposes.
A bill to provide regulatory parity among alternative fuel vehicles, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
